description:
Description

Take Control Initiative (TCI) works to remove barriers and increase access to birth control in Tulsa County. We work collaboratively with over 200 community partners, 20+ health center sites and several state and national organizations. TCI operates at the intersection of health and education with the underlying belief that individuals will make the best decisions for themselves when equipped with information and resources.

Tulsa Birth Equity Initiative (TBEI) currently partners with non-profit agencies, hospitals, community organizations that are delivering health and education services to expectant families in Tulsa. TBEI works to equip families in Tulsa to have healthy births with dignity and reduce maternal health disparities. We envision a Tulsa in which all people are centered and respected before, during, and after pregnancy.

TCI and TBEI are fiscally sponsored organizations at the Tulsa Community Foundation (TCF).

Position Summary:

The Creative Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for planning, implementing and monitoring all organizational digital platforms to increase brand awareness for two fiscally sponsored organizations under TCF - TCI and TBEI. This person will be responsible for assisting the Creative Marketing Manager with a comprehensive outreach strategy that will engage the community and key stakeholders in the organizational missions.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
• Co-develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy to meet the organizations’ objectives.
• Assist manager in the creation of high-quality visual graphics for use in both print and web applications.
• Curate engaging and high-quality content for various social media platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.
• Create consistent, meaningful content for dissemination, including writing and editing content consistent with the organization’s brands.
• Assist manager in managing 3-4 social media accounts, including content scheduling, posting, and monitoring.
• Analyze key social media metrics and use data-driven insights to refine our strategy and improve performance.
• Assist manager in brainstorming, participating, and implementing marketing campaigns for brand awareness and community engagement events.
• Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and best practices to stay at the forefront of social media marketing.
• Respond to comments, messages, and mentions in a timely and professional manner, fostering positive relationships with online communities upon approval of the manager.
• Collaborate with the creative team to ensure brand consistency across all platforms.
• Prepare monthly and quarterly reports on social media marketing and advertising efforts with analysis and suggestions for future strategies.
• Have the ability to seamlessly switch between projects and support both of the organizations’ marketing and communication goals & priorities.
• Attend TBEI staff meetings (monthly) and TCI staff meetings (weekly) to stay up to date on organizational events, goals & priorities.
• Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

Experience & Education:
• Bachelor's degree, OR equivalent experience, preferred in Marketing, Communications, Graphic Design or a related field.
• A minimum of 3 years of proven experience in marketing.

Desired Skills And Abilities:
• Strong understanding and experience working across social media platforms including, but not limited to: Facebook, Instagram, TikTok and LinkedIn.
• Must have strong Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign skills.
• Must have strong Canva skills.
• Strong project management and organizational skills which include being able to project plan, track tasks, assess progress, and follow through on the execution of plans while keeping stakeholders informed.
• Proficiency in researching new topics, curating and creating daily social media posts.
• Ability to multitask across the two organizations’ communication platforms (Slack, Trello, etc.).
• Spanish language skills preferred.
• Experience with documenting and editing video content.
• Knowledge of web design and content management systems (e.g. Wordpress and Webflow).
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Suite.
• Ability to build relationships with staff, partner organizations, and individuals from a wide range of perspectives.
• Strong writing skills in English and Spanish.
• Ability to write press releases.
• Strong attention to detail, critical eye for errors, correct grammar and spelling.
• Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

Physical Requirements:
• Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds and carry supplies and set-up for presentations and events as needed.
• This position continually requires the ability to talk and hear both in-person and over the phone, visual acuity; ability to operate equipment, read, and use a keyboard.
• This position requires sitting/standing in front of a computer screen for extended periods of time.
• Ability to travel locally within the Tulsa area and multiple locations within the program locations in Oklahoma.
• Valid driver’s license, and proof of insurance required

Hours and Location:
• TBEI and TCI have established offices based in Tulsa, Oklahoma.
• A typical work week is Monday - Friday from 8:30am - 5:00pm.
• The work week will occasionally vary and may require evenings or weekend hours to attend community events and/or off-site meetings.

About our Benefits:

As part of our overall compensation package, we offer work/life flexibility, comprehensive health benefits, paid time off, and a generous retirement contributions designed to support you and your family.

Details:
• 100% employer paid medical, dental, and long-term disability for full-time employees only. Option to add vision and dependents.
• 401K employee and employer contributions.
• Paid time off to support you while you are out of the office.
• Paid holidays so our employees can spend time with those they care about.
• Employer paid AD&D life insurance, with employee options to add supplemental life insurance.
